etymologies: mid 19th century: from mono-‘single’ + Greek trēma ‘hole’

definitions: a primitive mammal that lays large yolky eggs and has a common opening for the urogenital and digestive systems. Monotremes are now restricted to Australia and New Guinea, and comprise the platypus and the echidnas.

notes.text: Order Monotremata and subclass Prototheria: two families

shortDefinitions: primitive mammal that lays large yolky eggs and has common opening
